title: 111_s1366
content: Designation of income tax payments to Homeless Veterans Assistance Fund under new part added to Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Individuals with an adjusted income tax liability of $3 or more can designate $3 to the Homeless Veterans Assistance Fund. For joint filers with a liability of $6 or more, each spouse can also designate $3. Adjusted income tax liability is the excess of income tax liability over any previous designations made. Individuals can designate $3 to the Homeless Veterans Assistance Fund if their adjusted income tax liability is $3 or more. Joint filers with a liability of $6 or more can also designate $3 for each spouse. The designation can be made when filing the tax return or at a later time specified by the Secretary. The designation must be made in the manner prescribed by the Secretary, either on the first page of the return or on the page with the taxpayer's signature. The Homeless Veterans Assistance Fund allows individuals to designate $3 from their tax liability, or $3 for each spouse for joint filers with a liability of $6 or more. This designation can be made when filing the tax return or at a later time specified by the Secretary. The Homeless Veterans Assistance Fund is created in the Treasury of the United States, funded by appropriations or credits. Amounts designated under section 6098 are transferred to the fund. The fund supplements funds for services to homeless veterans provided by the Department of Veterans Affairs and the Department of Labor Veterans Employment and Training Service. The Homeless Veterans Assistance Fund is allocated proportionally to funding for homeless veterans programs administered by the Department of Veterans Affairs and the Department of Labor Veterans Employment and Training Service. The Department of Veterans Affairs and the Department of Labor can use the funds to support any homeless veteran program authorized under title 38, United States Code. Starting from the President's annual budget submission for fiscal year 2011, both departments must report on the use of funds from the previous fiscal year and propose future allocations. Clerical amendments are made to the table of parts for subchapter A of chapter 61 of the Code. The Homeless Veterans Assistance Fund is designated for funding homeless veterans programs. Amendments to the tax code allow for the allocation of funds to support authorized programs. The effective date for these amendments is for taxable years beginning after the enactment of the Act.
